```{r}
# 1. create an R notebook -- name it 11-14-2019

# 2. Load the **tidyverse packages**  and read in data -- given below.

library(tidyverse)
exfile <- "http://www.itk.ilstu.edu/faculty/jrwolf/pop-o-data.csv"
df <- read_csv(exfile)
df


head(df)

# 3. Use summarize to find the number of 1's, 2's, ..., 6's
df%>%
  group_by(pips)%>%
  summarise(n=n())
# 4. Use summarize and group-by to find the number of 1's, 2's, ..., 6's for the Pop-o-matic and Excel dice data. 

dd <- df%>%
  group_by(type, pips)%>%
  summarise(n=n())
dd

# 5. Create a bar chart showing the number of 1's, 2's, ..., 6's for BOTH the Pop-o-matic and Excel dice data. Use facet_wrap() to show the charts side-by-side. 

ggplot (dd, aes(pips, n, fill="pips"))+
  
  geom_bar(stat="identity", color="blue", fill="purple") +facet_wrap((~type))
```
